intro: Guihaia argyrata, commonly known as silverleaf guihaia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating that contributes to its silvery appearance. The flowers are small and clustered, usually white or pale pink, and appear in the spring.
